attributes.Title: General Microbiology
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Microbiology
310
UMass Amherst
Overview of the microbial world including a survey of the structure, functioning, and diversity of microorganisms. Introduction to the fundamental concepts of microbial physiology, ecology, genetics, and pathogenesis. Prerequisite: CHEM 250, CHEM 261 or concurrent enrollment.
This class is open to Microbiology, Animal Science, Pre-Veterinary, Human Nutrition and Environmental Science majors only.  
Course will open to all majors on December 1, 2015.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
64600
Requisite: Overview of the microbial world including a survey of the structure, functioning, and diversity of microorganisms. Introduction to the fundamental concepts of microbial physiology, ecology, genetics, and pathogenesis. Prerequisite: CHEM 250, CHEM 261 or concurrent enrollment.

attributes.Title: Survey of Food Science
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Food Science
265
UMass Amherst
The role of food processing and ingredient technology on food quality and safety, including principles and methods of food processing, food standards and regulation, quality control and assurance, and overviews of engineering, chemical, microbiological, and nutritional concerns.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36985

attributes.Title: Food Chemistry
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Food Science
541
UMass Amherst
Overview of the chemical, physical, and biological properties of food components including proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, and pigments. Consequences of the properties of food components and their reaction products to health and nutrition also emphasized. Prerequisite: organic chemistry.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
71123
66953
Requisite: Overview of the chemical, physical, and biological properties of food components including proteins, lipids, carbohydrates, and pigments. Consequences of the properties of food components and their reaction products to health and nutrition also emphasized. Prerequisite: organic chemistry.

attributes.Title: Sem-Junior Writing
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Food Science
391C
UMass Amherst
Writing of various types of reports dealing with scientific and technical information. Includes at least one oral presentation dealing with some aspect of food science. Selected exercises peer-reviewed before submission. Prerequisite: completion of freshman writing requirement.
Food Science majors only Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 112 or CW
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36959
Requisite: Writing of various types of reports dealing with scientific and technical information. Includes at least one oral presentation dealing with some aspect of food science. Selected exercises peer-reviewed before submission. Prerequisite: completion of freshman writing requirement.

attributes.Title: Food Preservation-Why&How
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Food Science
120
UMass Amherst
Food preservation methods such as sterilization methods, refrigeration, freezing, drying explained in terms of physical, chemical, and biological principles. Their implementation in industrial processes and impact on society evaluated.  (Gen.Ed. PS)
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66948

attributes.Title: College Writing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
English Writing Program
112
UMass Amherst
ENGLWRIT 112 (College Writing) is a first-year college-level writing course designed to help students expand their ability to write essays for academic, civic, and personal purposes and to develop their rhetorical awareness to write effectively in new social contexts. Based on the assumption that writing is a social activity, this course requires active engagement in the writing process, including pre-writing, peer review, revision, and editing. Students write five essays. This is the only course at UMass Amherst which satisfies the General Education College Writing (CW) requirement. Prerequisite: Placement into ENGLWRIT 112 through the Writing Placement Exam or a passing grade in ENGLWRIT 111 Basic Writing. May not be taken Pass/Fail.  (Gen.Ed. CW)
Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 111 (or adequate performance on Writing Program placement test). Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 111
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
61710
Requisite: ENGLWRIT 112 (College Writing) is a first-year college-level writing course designed to help students expand their ability to write essays for academic, civic, and personal purposes and to develop their rhetorical awareness to write effectively in new social contexts. Based on the assumption that writing is a social activity, this course requires active engagement in the writing process, including pre-writing, peer review, revision, and editing. Students write five essays. This is the only course at UMass Amherst which satisfies the General Education College Writing (CW) requirement. Prerequisite: Placement into ENGLWRIT 112 through the Writing Placement Exam or a passing grade in ENGLWRIT 111 Basic Writing. May not be taken Pass/Fail.  (Gen.Ed. CW)
Prerequisite: ENGLWRIT 111 (or adequate performance on Writing Program placement test). Pre Req: ENGLWRIT 111

attributes.Title: Food Chemistry
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Food Science
542
UMass Amherst
Chemistry of food minor components (e.g. minerals, vitamins, nutraceuticals, colors, flavors), direct food additives (e.g. preservatives, texture modifiers and stabilizers, colors, flavors), incidental food additives (e.g. processing aids, chemical toxins), intentional adulterants, allergens, etc.
FOOD-SCI 541  Students should have completed an organic chemistry class (Chem 261 or Chem 250)
Students who do not meet the prerequisite may contact Dr. Lili He to enroll.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36990
Requisite: Students who do not meet the prerequisite may contact Dr. Lili He to enroll.

attributes.Title: Food Processing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Food Science
561
UMass Amherst
This course will introduce students to the fundamentals of product development as well as current topics and concerns in the food industry. Student teams will develop a food product from concept to production. This project will incorporate the student?s knowledge in chemistry, engineering, microbiology as well as social sciences. A market analysis will involve investigation of current food movements and health concerns. Students will also learn basic engineering concepts in order to produce their product in a pilot scale-plant.
Satisfies IE requirement
Food Science majors only   Others with Permission of Instructor.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66927

attributes.Title: The Nature of Food
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Food Science
160
UMass Amherst
An introduction to the scientific nature of everyday foodstuffs.  Examines the chemical composition and physical structure of foods.  Also examines the properties of food components which affect appearance, color, flavor, texture and nutritional value.  Changes during storage, cooking and processing are considered for their effect on quality.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36981

attributes.Title: Phys Phenomena In Food
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Food Science
761
UMass Amherst
Physical and functional properties of foods: origin and modification of surface forces; electrophysical phenomena; colloidal aggregates and dispersions; stability of emulsions and foams; adsorption phenomena; properties of  food polymers in solution; interfacial charge effects; structure and formation of gels.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66950

attributes.Description:

2016

583
UMass Amherst
Description not available at this time

Non-Majors may enroll with permission from the instructor as well.
Additional fees are associated with this section.

attributes.Title: Food And Health
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Food Science
101
UMass Amherst
The role of food technology in meeting health needs. Topics include the development of new foods for the control of weight, reduction of risk in chronic diseases, and the utilization of food science to produce a varied, safe, healthy, and nutritionally sound diet. The possible alleviation of world hunger through technology.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66943

attributes.Title: Food Microbiolgy Lab
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Food Science
566
UMass Amherst
Laboratory exercises emphasize quality control and experimental approaches to food microbiology. Labs teach basic culture methods, in addition to chemical, immunological, and molecular techniques employed for the microbiological analysis of foods. Prerequisites: MICROBIO 312 and concurrent registration in FOOD-SCI 567 or consent of instructor.
Food Science majors only   Students should have completed an organic chemistry class (Chem 261 or Chem 250)
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36965
Requisite: Laboratory exercises emphasize quality control and experimental approaches to food microbiology. Labs teach basic culture methods, in addition to chemical, immunological, and molecular techniques employed for the microbiological analysis of foods. Prerequisites: MICROBIO 312 and concurrent registration in FOOD-SCI 567 or consent of instructor.

attributes.Title: Hyg Food Handling
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Food Science
466
UMass Amherst
With lab. Overview of microbiology principles as applied to food safety. Emphasis on the control of microbial food-borne illnesses in institutional and industrial settings. Labs teach basic techniques used for microbial testing of foods.
This course is open to Human Nutrition and Food Science majors only   Students should have taken organic chemistry (Chem 262 or equivalent) or be taking it concurrently
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
66939

attributes.Title: Analysis Food Products
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Food Science
581
UMass Amherst
Physical, chemical, and spectroscopic techniques in food analysis: proximate analysis, extraction, densimetry, spectroscopy, rheology, microscopy, refractometry, polarimetry, chromatography, enzymatic and immunological assays, and sensory evaluation methods emphasizing theoretical basis of measurements and laboratory calculations. Prerequisite: Chem 312 or equivalent.
Should have completed Food Science 541 before enrolling (or see instructor for permission).
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
71125
66928
Requisite: Physical, chemical, and spectroscopic techniques in food analysis: proximate analysis, extraction, densimetry, spectroscopy, rheology, microscopy, refractometry, polarimetry, chromatography, enzymatic and immunological assays, and sensory evaluation methods emphasizing theoretical basis of measurements and laboratory calculations. Prerequisite: Chem 312 or equivalent.

attributes.Title: Biol. of Food in Human Health
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Food Science
270
UMass Amherst
This course will evaluate the biological significance of food.  It will cover a basic description of physiology, demonstration of pathology, and evaluation of the role of foods and food components in disease prevention.
Pre Req: Biology 100 or 102
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36984

attributes.Title: Food Science Policy
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Food Science
590A
UMass Amherst
To understand the basis of food policy and the role science has in its development.  This course covers food law policy and regulations and how science might be better used in formulating current and future policies.
Life Science Background Required
Pre Requisite: General Science
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
36986

attributes.Description:

2016

575
UMass Amherst

66938

attributes.Title: The Science Of Food
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Food Science
150
UMass Amherst
Biological and chemical principles underlying the maintenance of food quality during the period after harvest to consumption. Topics include chemical, enzymic, physical, and biological deterioration; implications and prevention; food toxicology.  (Gen.Ed. BS)
Multiple required components--lab and/or discussion section. To register, submit requests for all components simultaneously.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
